strapiPost.title: Northwest Arkansas Poultry Farm Goes Solar
strapiPost.content:
North Little Rock-based solar energy company Seal Solar has nearly completed the installation of one of the nation's largest solar arrays of its kind in Northwest Arkansas.

  • Rooster's crow: The 288.64-kilowatt DC array will supply power for Dixie Acres Farm, a poultry operation in Cincinnati, just south of Siloam Springs, and is expected to be operational in January.
  • Hatching savings: The project will pay back its worth in about two years, saving the farm approximately $24,000 annually.

Read the full article on Talk Business & Politics HERE.
